original: dper na sngon gyi dus su bya khyung gi 'jigs pa dang bral bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: dper na sngon gyi dus su bya khyung gi 'jigs pa dang bral bar byed pa ni /
translated: For example, in the past, in order to free them from the fear of garuḍas,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa rig pa'i rgyal po rnam par shes pa sbyin pa'i rgyal bur skyes te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa rig pa'i rgyal po rnam par shes pa sbyin pa'i rgyal bur skyes te /
translated: the perfect, complete Buddha Śākyamuni was born as the son of the king of knowledge, King Consciousness-Donor.

original: yum ni bkra shis sbyin /
analyzed: yum ni bkra shis sbyin /
translated: His mother was Auspicious Donor.

original: btsun mo ni bkra shis lcam yul ni rigs bzang dam pa'o //
analyzed: btsun mo ni bkra shis lcam yul ni rigs bzang dam pa'o //
translated: His queen was Auspicious Lady. The country was the excellent, holy family.

original: de'i yul na chos dar zhing mi rigs pa ni mi byed cing /
analyzed: de'i yul na chos dar zhing mi rigs pa ni mi byed cing /
translated: In that country, the Dharma flourished, and people did not do improper things.

original: byang chub sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They had the thought of awakening.

original: rgyal po rnam shes sbyin gyi sras mtshan yang rnam shes gson sbyin pa'o//
analyzed: rgyal po rnam shes sbyin gyi sras mtshan yang rnam shes gson sbyin pa'o//
translated: King Consciousness-Donor had a son named Consciousness-Donor-the-Living.

original: rgyal bu de yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgyal bu de yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: That prince had the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: sems can thams cad la nor dang 'bru dang gos la sogs pa'i sbyin pa byin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la nor dang 'bru dang gos la sogs pa'i sbyin pa byin pa'o //
translated: He gave to all sentient beings the gifts of wealth, grain, clothes, and so forth.

original: rgyal bu de yang nam zhig na snying dga' bshes gnyen dang 'grogs nas ma la'i rtse mor phyin te /
analyzed: rgyal bu de yang nam zhig na snying dga' bshes gnyen dang 'grogs nas ma la'i rtse mor phyin te /
translated: One day that prince, in a happy mood, went to the top of a hill with his friends.

original: ma la'i ri'i rtse mo la klu'i keng rus mthong nas snying dga' bshes gnyen la dris pa'o //
analyzed: ma la'i ri'i rtse mo la klu'i keng rus mthong nas snying dga' bshes gnyen la dris pa'o //
translated: On the summit of the Malaya mountain, he saw the skeleton of a naga. His heart was gladdened. He asked his friend:

original: kye ho snying gi grogs gnyen 'di'i keng rus ni gang gi keng rus yin gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kye ho snying gi grogs gnyen 'di'i keng rus ni gang gi keng rus yin gsungs pa'o //
translated: Oh! My friend, whose skeleton is this?

original: grogs gnyen gyis smras pa /
analyzed: grogs gnyen gyis smras pa /
translated: His friend replied:

original: kye'i rgyal bu nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig gis nang ma re re rgya mtsho'i nang nas 'ongs nas klu rnams kyi keng rus yin zhes smras so //
analyzed: kye'i rgyal bu nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig gis nang ma re re rgya mtsho'i nang nas 'ongs nas klu rnams kyi keng rus yin zhes smras so //
translated: Oh Prince, it is the skeleton of a naga. Every day, the king of the garudas, Suparni, comes from the ocean and devours a naga.

original: de bstan pa dang / rgyal bus zhal rog bzhugs shing snying mi dga' bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa dang / rgyal bus zhal rog bzhugs shing snying mi dga' bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The prince, hearing this, remained silent, his heart sad.

original: dus gcig tu grogs gzhan dang ma 'grogs shing rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin no //
analyzed: dus gcig tu grogs gzhan dang ma 'grogs shing rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin no //
translated: One day, he went to the ocean shore, alone, without his friend.

original: klu'i jo mo rgyal bu gtsug tor can gyi yum bshums pa dang rgya mtsho'i @107b 'gram du phrad do //
analyzed: klu'i jo mo rgyal bu gtsug tor can gyi yum bshums pa dang rgya mtsho'i @107b 'gram du phrad do //
translated: The naga queen, mother of Prince Śikhin, was weeping. She met the prince on the ocean shore.

original: kyi hud kyi hud dung gi gtsug tor can //
analyzed: kyi hud kyi hud dung gi gtsug tor can //
translated: Alas! Alas! Śikhin!

original: kyi hud kyi hud zla ba'i spyan mnga'i bu //
analyzed: kyi hud kyi hud zla ba'i spyan mnga'i bu //
translated: Alas! Alas! Son of the moon-eyed one!

original: zhes thos pa dang / snying rje ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i rtsar phyin no //
analyzed: zhes thos pa dang / snying rje ldan zhing byang chub sems dpa'i rtsar phyin no //
translated: Hearing this, he went to the Bodhisattva out of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpas klu'i jo mo la smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas klu'i jo mo la smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said to the nāga queen:

original: kye ho jo mo tsi'i don la bshums zhes smras so //
analyzed: kye ho jo mo tsi'i don la bshums zhes smras so //
translated: “Hey, lady, why are you crying?”

original: yum gyis smras pa /
analyzed: yum gyis smras pa /
translated: His mother said:

original: nga'i don mi 'grub ces smras so //
analyzed: nga'i don mi 'grub ces smras so //
translated: “My purpose will not be accomplished.”

original: yang rgyal bus smras pa /
analyzed: yang rgyal bus smras pa /
translated: The prince said again:

original: gal te don 'grub par gyur na ci sto zhes smras so //
analyzed: gal te don 'grub par gyur na ci sto zhes smras so //
translated: “If your purpose is accomplished, what is the problem?”

original: yum gyis smras pa bshums shing kha nas mi thon yang smras so //
analyzed: yum gyis smras pa bshums shing kha nas mi thon yang smras so //
translated: His mother said, crying and unable to speak:

original: kye ho skyes bu dam pa nga'i bu dung gi gtsug tor can sang nyi ma phyed na nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig can gyis khyer nas za ba'i dus la bab pas thabs 'dra ba mnga' 'am zhes smras so //
analyzed: kye ho skyes bu dam pa nga'i bu dung gi gtsug tor can sang nyi ma phyed na nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig can gyis khyer nas za ba'i dus la bab pas thabs 'dra ba mnga' 'am zhes smras so //
translated: “O holy being, my son Śaṅkusaṃkukṣa will be carried off by the garuḍa king Suparṇī tomorrow at noon and eaten. Do you have a plan?”

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: ngas rjes ni ji tsugs byed du 'ong smras so //
analyzed: ngas rjes ni ji tsugs byed du 'ong smras so //
translated: “What can I do?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / rgya mtsho'i nang du khrid do //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / rgya mtsho'i nang du khrid do //
translated: Having said this, he was taken into the ocean.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po dung can gyi bu dung gi gtsug tor can lo brgyad lon pa blta na sdug pa kha dog dang ldan pa de bltas nas /
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po dung can gyi bu dung gi gtsug tor can lo brgyad lon pa blta na sdug pa kha dog dang ldan pa de bltas nas /
translated: Then, the son of the nāga king Śaṅkhapāla, Śaṅkhakuṇḍala, who was eight years old, handsome, and had a beautiful complexion, was seen.

original: klu'i bu mo tsam 'dus so //
analyzed: klu'i bu mo tsam 'dus so //
translated: The nāga girl Cāpā was also there.

original: de'i rting la byang chub sems dpa' sngar 'ong ba'i khri la dar dmar po gyon nas gzims so //
analyzed: de'i rting la byang chub sems dpa' sngar 'ong ba'i khri la dar dmar po gyon nas gzims so //
translated: After that, the bodhisattva went to sleep on the throne he had previously occupied, wearing red silk.

original: de nas nyi ma phyed kyi dus la nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig can mchu de ni bee d'u rya dang 'dra ba mtho ba rno ba /
analyzed: de nas nyi ma phyed kyi dus la nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig can mchu de ni bee d'u rya dang 'dra ba mtho ba rno ba /
translated: Then, at noon, the king of garuḍas, Suparṇakṣa, with a beak like beryl, high, sharp,

original: mig ser zhing dmar ba la sogs pa ring zhing sngo ba /
analyzed: mig ser zhing dmar ba la sogs pa ring zhing sngo ba /
translated: yellowish-red eyes, and so on, long and blue,

original: yan lag sder mo ring zhing rno ba /
analyzed: yan lag sder mo ring zhing rno ba /
translated: with long, sharp claws,

original: bya khyung gi gzugs bzhin du 'jigs pa /
analyzed: bya khyung gi gzugs bzhin du 'jigs pa /
translated: frightening like the form of Garuḍa,

original: nam mkha' la 'brug sgra dang 'grogs shing /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'brug sgra dang 'grogs shing /
translated: roaring in the sky,

original: me'i glog bzhin bstan zhing ;
analyzed: me'i glog bzhin bstan zhing ;
translated: shining like lightning,

original: bar snang nas gshog pa rgya mtsho'i nang du rdebs pa /
analyzed: bar snang nas gshog pa rgya mtsho'i nang du rdebs pa /
translated: flapping his wings in the sky and striking the ocean,

original: g-yas pa'i gshog pa brdabs pas rgya mtsho'i chu mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i gshog pa brdabs pas rgya mtsho'i chu mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: With a blow of his right wing, the ocean water disappeared.

original: g-yon pa brdabs pas bdun brgya'i sa'i 'og tu slebs so //
analyzed: g-yon pa brdabs pas bdun brgya'i sa'i 'og tu slebs so //
translated: With a blow of his left wing, he reached the bottom of the seven hundred leagues.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' khri la nyal ba de tog gis blangs nas nam mkha' la khyer ro //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' khri la nyal ba de tog gis blangs nas nam mkha' la khyer ro //
translated: Then the bodhisattva, lying on the throne, was picked up by Garuḍa and carried into the sky.

original: de'i rting bar snang la khyer ba de byang chub sems dpa'i yab dang yum dang / jo mo rnams kyis mthong nas cho nges 'debs shing mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: de'i rting bar snang la khyer ba de byang chub sems dpa'i yab dang yum dang / jo mo rnams kyis mthong nas cho nges 'debs shing mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: When his mother, father, and sisters saw him being carried off into the sky, they cried out in grief and died.

original: de nas bya khyung des ri ma la ya'i rtse mor khyer nas sha zos khrag 'thungs te /🔽sha gzhogs @108a * //
analyzed: de nas bya khyung des ri ma la ya'i rtse mor khyer nas sha zos khrag 'thungs te / sha gzhogs @108a * //
translated: Then Garuḍa carried him to the peak of Mount Malaya, where he ate his flesh and drank his blood.

original: gcig zad nas /
analyzed: gcig zad nas /
translated: He ate one side of the flesh🔽and was about to eat the other side.

original: byang chub sems dpas gzhogs gcig tu zlogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gzhogs gcig tu zlogs so //
translated: The bodhisattva turned his body around.

original: de nas bya khyung 'jigs pa'i sems dang ldan te /
analyzed: de nas bya khyung 'jigs pa'i sems dang ldan te /
translated: Then Garuḍa, with a frightened mind,

original: za ba 'phro bcad nas ngo mtshar che zhing klu rnams sngar ji tsam zos pa la 'di 'dra ba ma byung snyam nas 'phro bcad de 'dug go //
analyzed: za ba 'phro bcad nas ngo mtshar che zhing klu rnams sngar ji tsam zos pa la 'di 'dra ba ma byung snyam nas 'phro bcad de 'dug go //
translated: He stopped eating and thought, This is very strange. I have never seen anything like this before. He stopped eating and sat there.

original: de'i tshe byang chub dpas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub dpas smras pa /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva said,

original: kye rgyal po nam mkha' lding khyod kyi gsos yin mod khrag 'thung sha zo //
analyzed: kye rgyal po nam mkha' lding khyod kyi gsos yin mod khrag 'thung sha zo //
translated: Oh king, you are the food of the garuda. Drink his blood and eat his flesh.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / bya khyung gis ngo mtshar che nas smras pa /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / bya khyung gis ngo mtshar che nas smras pa /
translated: When he said this, the garuda was amazed and said,

original: kye khyod su yin snga ma bzhin du ma byung ngo //
analyzed: kye khyod su yin snga ma bzhin du ma byung ngo //
translated: Oh, who are you? You are not like before.

original: ngas kyang sngar ji tsam zos te khyod bzhin ngas ma mthong ngo ;
analyzed: ngas kyang sngar ji tsam zos te khyod bzhin ngas ma mthong ngo ;
translated: I too have eaten as much as I could, but I have never seen anything like this.

original: ; byang chub sems dpa'i zhal nas khyod kyis 'dis ci smos zo zhig 'thungs shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ; byang chub sems dpa'i zhal nas khyod kyis 'dis ci smos zo zhig 'thungs shig ces gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva said, What are you talking about? Eat this and drink this.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' yab yum gyis kyang slebs nas bya khyung gi drung du cho nges 'debs shing smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' yab yum gyis kyang slebs nas bya khyung gi drung du cho nges 'debs shing smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva's parents also arrived and wailed in front of the garuda, saying,

original: kye ho nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po /
analyzed: kye ho nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po /
translated: Oh, oh, king of the garudas!

original: nga'i bus nyes pa cang yod dam khyod ci nyes ci bsams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nga'i bus nyes pa cang yod dam khyod ci nyes ci bsams zhes gsungs so //
translated: “What has my son done wrong? What have you done?”

original: de skad gsungs pa dang / bya khyung de yang sdug bsngal gyis zin to //
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa dang / bya khyung de yang sdug bsngal gyis zin to //
translated: When he said this, the garuḍa was overcome with suffering.

original: de nas bya khyung gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bya khyung gis smras pa /
translated: Then the garuḍa said:

original: kye ho byang chub sems dpa' ngas ngo ma shes na /
analyzed: kye ho byang chub sems dpa' ngas ngo ma shes na /
translated: “Alas, Bodhisattva, I did not know.

original: bzod par gsol /
analyzed: bzod par gsol /
translated: Please forgive me.”

original: das lha yul du phyin nas bdud rtsi khyer nas 'ongs nas bskus te sos par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: das lha yul du phyin nas bdud rtsi khyer nas 'ongs nas bskus te sos par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “I will go to the god realm and bring back nectar. When I return, I will anoint him and he will be healed.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: When he said this, the bodhisattva said:

original: kye ho rgyal po khyed kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mi byang byang chub sems dang ldan na lus sngar bzhin du song shig / de'i sems dang mi ldan na da lta bzhin du song shig ces smras so //
analyzed: kye ho rgyal po khyed kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mi byang byang chub sems dang ldan na lus sngar bzhin du song shig / de'i sems dang mi ldan na da lta bzhin du song shig ces smras so //
translated: “Alas, king, by the power of your words, if the man has the bodhisattva mind, let his body become as it was before. If he does not have that mind, let him remain as he is.”

original: de'i tshig gi bden pas lus sngar bzhin du gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshig gi bden pas lus sngar bzhin du gyur to //
translated: By the truth of those words, the man’s body became as it was before.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas bya khyung la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas bya khyung la smras pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva said to the garuḍa:🔽“

original: khyod kyis rgya mtsho'i nang du song la klu rnams bos shig / ces gsungs pa dang / bya khyung langs nas rgya mtsho'i nang du song ngo //
analyzed: khyod kyis rgya mtsho'i nang du song la klu rnams bos shig / ces gsungs pa dang / bya khyung langs nas rgya mtsho'i nang du song ngo //
translated: The garuḍa rose up and flew into the ocean.

original: klu rnams bya khyung mthong ba dang / 'jigs nas da yang nga cag rnams thams cad bos te gsod snyam nas /
analyzed: klu rnams bya khyung mthong ba dang / 'jigs nas da yang nga cag rnams thams cad bos te gsod snyam nas /
translated: When the nāgas saw the garuḍa, they were terrified, thinking, Now he will summon all of us and kill us.

original: de'i 'jigs pas klu rnams ma khugs /
analyzed: de'i 'jigs pas klu rnams ma khugs /
translated: Out of fear of him, the nāgas did not come out.

original: bya khyung yar log nas byang chub sems dpa'i drung du gnas so //
analyzed: bya khyung yar log nas byang chub sems dpa'i drung du gnas so //
translated: The garuḍa returned and remained in the presence of the bodhisattva.

original: kye byang chub sems dpa'i ngas klu rnams ma khugs so zhes so //
analyzed: kye byang chub sems dpa'i ngas klu rnams ma khugs so zhes so //
translated: He said, Oh bodhisattva, I have not been able to summon the nāgas.

original: byang chub @108b sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub @108b sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva said,

original: khyod kyis lha'i yul nas bdud rtsi khyer nas 'ongs nas khyod kyis zos pa'i keng rus kyi thog tu bdud rtsi gtor cig gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis lha'i yul nas bdud rtsi khyer nas 'ongs nas khyod kyis zos pa'i keng rus kyi thog tu bdud rtsi gtor cig gsungs so //
translated: Take the nectar from the realm of the gods and sprinkle it on the skeleton that you have eaten.

original: de nas bya khyung gis bdud rtsi gtor nas sngar shi ba'i klu rnams sos nas byung ste /
analyzed: de nas bya khyung gis bdud rtsi gtor nas sngar shi ba'i klu rnams sos nas byung ste /
translated: Then the garuḍa sprinkled the nectar and the nāgas who had died before were revived.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyan sngar gnas so ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyan sngar gnas so ;
translated: They came out and remained in the presence of the bodhisattva.

original: ; byang chub sems dpa'i zhal nas /
analyzed: ; byang chub sems dpa'i zhal nas /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: bya khyung gis klu rnams ma khugs pas /
analyzed: bya khyung gis klu rnams ma khugs pas /
translated: The garuḍa cannot catch the nāgas.

original: khyed rnams kyis klu rnams bos la shog cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis klu rnams bos la shog cig ces gsungs so //
translated: You nāgas, come out and let him catch you!

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / klu rnams kyis rgya mtsho'i nang na yod pa rnams bos nas 'ongs so //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / klu rnams kyis rgya mtsho'i nang na yod pa rnams bos nas 'ongs so //
translated: When he had spoken thus, the nāgas, summoned from the depths of the ocean, came out.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpas klu rnams la sngom pa phog ste dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'am sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa'am de sems can la gnod byed bya khyung gis 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpas klu rnams la sngom pa phog ste dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'am sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa'am de sems can la gnod byed bya khyung gis 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time the Bodhisattva made the nāgas take the vow not to harm sentient beings, or to go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de bzhin du bya khyung gis kyang sngom pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du bya khyung gis kyang sngom pa la gnas shing /
translated: In the same way, the garuḍa also took the vow.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i gzi brjid dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi byin rlabs kyis klu rnams la yang bya khyung gi 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i gzi brjid dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi byin rlabs kyis klu rnams la yang bya khyung gi 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: By the splendor of the queen of incantations and the blessing of the Three Jewels, the nāgas were freed from the fear of the garuḍa.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas kyang /
translated: In the same way, the perfectly awakened Śākyamuni

original: klu la sogs pa'i sems can la byams pa'o //🔽gad dag sa la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: klu la sogs pa'i sems can la byams pa'o // gad dag sa la gnas pa yi //
translated: Love for sentient beings such as nāgas.🔽I love all spirits

original: 'byung po kun la nga byams so //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la nga byams so //
translated: who dwell on the earth.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po lha dang / klu dang lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / rlung lha dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / grul bum dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po lha dang / klu dang lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / rlung lha dang / dri za dang / mi'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / grul bum dang /
translated: Spirits are gods, nāgas, demigods, garuḍas, wind gods, gandharvas, kiṃpuruṣas, mahoragas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, kumbhāṇḍas,

original: srul po dang / lus srul po dang / sha za dang / grib gnon dang / skem byed dang / smyo byed dang / gnon po dang / rgyu skar la sogs pa'i gdon rnams yin te /
analyzed: srul po dang / lus srul po dang / sha za dang / grib gnon dang / skem byed dang / smyo byed dang / gnon po dang / rgyu skar la sogs pa'i gdon rnams yin te /
translated: pūtanas, kaṭapūtanas, piśācas, kridurasas, unmādas, apasmāras, nakṣatras, and so on.

original: 'byung po de rnams kyang stong phrag brgyad cu brgyad cu gnas te /
analyzed: 'byung po de rnams kyang stong phrag brgyad cu brgyad cu gnas te /
translated: Those spirits are of eighty-eight thousand kinds.

original: de dag sa la rgyu ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: de dag sa la rgyu ba rnams yin te /
translated: They move on the earth.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' dang / sa stengs su rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' dang / sa stengs su rgyu ba'o //
translated: Similarly, they move in the sky and on the earth.

original: de kun la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byams pa'o //
analyzed: de kun la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byams pa'o //
translated: The perfect Buddha loves them all.

original: sems can gang dag gnas par bcas //
analyzed: sems can gang dag gnas par bcas //
translated: And all sentient beings who dwell there.

original: sems can kun la nga byams so //
analyzed: sems can kun la nga byams so //
translated: I have love for all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams la yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams la yang de bzhin te /
translated: This means that in the trichiliocosm world system, and also in other world systems,

original: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid dang / bden pa'i tshig des /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid dang / bden pa'i tshig des /
translated: by the splendor of the knowledge mantra and the power of these true words,

original: @109a * // rdul phra mo la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la yang byams so //🔽sems can kun dang srog chags kun //
analyzed: @109a * // rdul phra mo la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la yang byams so // sems can kun dang srog chags kun //
translated: I have love for sentient beings who dwell in the smallest particles.🔽All sentient beings, all living beings,

original: 'byung po dag ni thams cad kyang //
analyzed: 'byung po dag ni thams cad kyang //
translated: And all spirits.

original: zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i tshig 'dis dug gi nad bsam pa dang / tshor ba dang / kha rlangs rnams yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i tshig 'dis dug gi nad bsam pa dang / tshor ba dang / kha rlangs rnams yin te /
translated: By these true words, the poison is thought, feeling, and breath.

original: de ni 'gro ba'i dug go //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba'i dug go //
translated: That is the poison of beings.

original: bsdad pa'i dug ni rtsa ba dang lo ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsdad pa'i dug ni rtsa ba dang lo ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The poison of dwelling is roots, leaves, and so forth.

original: byed pa'i dug ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i dug ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The poison of action arises from application.

original: dug de dag thams cad kyang sems can dang srog chags dang 'byung po rnams la yang byams pa'o //
analyzed: dug de dag thams cad kyang sems can dang srog chags dang 'byung po rnams la yang byams pa'o //
translated: All those poisons I have love for sentient beings, living beings, and spirits.

original: thams cad bde ba 'ba' zhig shog / thams cad nad ni med gyur cig / ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal brgyad dang / rlung dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan las gyur pa de la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi rnams yin te /
analyzed: thams cad bde ba 'ba' zhig shog / thams cad nad ni med gyur cig / ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal brgyad dang / rlung dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan las gyur pa de la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi rnams yin te /
translated: This refers to the eight worldly sufferings and the four hundred and four diseases, such as those caused by wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: bden pa'i tshig des de rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral zhing bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig des de rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral zhing bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: By this truth, may they all be free from suffering and live in happiness.🔽May all see the pure and good!🔽May no one ever do wrong!

original: kun du bzang po mthong bar shog / gang yang sdig par ma gyur cig / ces bya ba ni mnar med pa'i sems can nas tshangs pa'i yul man chad kyi bde bar gnas /
analyzed: kun du bzang po mthong bar shog / gang yang sdig par ma gyur cig / ces bya ba ni mnar med pa'i sems can nas tshangs pa'i yul man chad kyi bde bar gnas /
translated: This refers to the beings in the Avici hell up to the realm of Brahma.

original: las kyi sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / bag chags kyi sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: May they be free from the obscurations of karma, the obscurations of the knowable, and the obscurations of habitual tendencies.

original: yang na shes nas byas pa dang mi shes nas byas pa rnams dang yang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na shes nas byas pa dang mi shes nas byas pa rnams dang yang bral ba'o //
translated: Or, may they be free from the obscurations of what is done knowingly and unknowingly.

original: byams pa'i sems la gnas nas su //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems la gnas nas su //
translated: Abiding in a loving mind,

original: dug ni rab tu gsad par bya //
analyzed: dug ni rab tu gsad par bya //
translated: I will destroy the poison.

original: zhes bya ba ni byams pa ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten la gnas pa'i sems can la bu gcig po lam byams pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byams pa ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten la gnas pa'i sems can la bu gcig po lam byams pa lta bu ste /
translated: Love is the love of a mother or father for their only child, extended to all sentient beings living in the great billion world universe.

original: de nye bar gzhag pa'i sems kyis snying rje 'ba' zhig tu 'khor ba la gnas pa'i sems can la snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: de nye bar gzhag pa'i sems kyis snying rje 'ba' zhig tu 'khor ba la gnas pa'i sems can la snying rje ba'o //
translated: Compassion is the compassion of one who, having established that attitude, remains in cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: des sems can thon pa'i sems kyis des rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: des sems can thon pa'i sems kyis des rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Sympathetic joy is the joy of one who, having established that attitude, is delighted by the success of sentient beings.

original: de mnyam pa nyid du gzhag pas btang snyoms so //
analyzed: de mnyam pa nyid du gzhag pas btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the equanimity of one who, having established that attitude, remains in cyclic existence without being affected by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: 'dir ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas /
translated: Here, the perfect Buddha Śākyamuni

original: dge slong sa ri'i don la sems can thams cad kyi don gyis nang gi dug gsum dang phyi'i dug gsum zad pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong sa ri'i don la sems can thams cad kyi don gyis nang gi dug gsum dang phyi'i dug gsum zad pa'o //
translated: taught the monk Śaila that the meaning of the three phrases is the exhaustion of the three internal poisons and the three external poisons for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: nang gi dug gsum ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gsum mo //
analyzed: nang gi dug gsum ni 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug gsum mo //
translated: The three internal poisons are attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: phyi'i dug gsum ni de nye bar gzhag pas byung ba /
analyzed: phyi'i dug gsum ni de nye bar gzhag pas byung ba /
translated: The three external poisons are those that arise from the internal poisons,

original: 'gro ba dang bsdad pa @109b dang byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bsdad pa @109b dang byed pa'o //
translated: and are produced by going and staying.

original: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid dang / sangs rgyas kyi bden pas byams pas dug zad pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid dang / sangs rgyas kyi bden pas byams pas dug zad pa'o //
translated: By the splendor of the knowledge-mantra and by the truth of the Buddha, Maitreya has eliminated the poison.

original: bsrung dang yongs su bzung ba dang // de bzhin yongs su bskyang bar bya //
analyzed: bsrung dang yongs su bzung ba dang // de bzhin yongs su bskyang bar bya //
translated: One should protect, thoroughly protect, and likewise thoroughly care for.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i bden pa 'dis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa'i bden pa 'dis te /
translated: This is the truth of the verse.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bka'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bka'o //
translated: It is the word of the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: de yang 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnam gzigs dang // gtsug tor can dang kun skyob dang / log dang sel dang gser thub 'od srungs so //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnam gzigs dang // gtsug tor can dang kun skyob dang / log dang sel dang gser thub 'od srungs so //
translated: Moreover, it is spoken by the past Buddhas Vipaśyin, Śikhin, Viśvabhū, Krakucchanda, Kanakamuni, Kāśyapa, and Dīpaṃkara.

original: de la sogs pa'i 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is spoken by the past Buddhas beginning with those, as many as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The future [Buddhas] are likewise Maitreya and so on.

original: da ltar ba ni sh'akya seng ge ste /
analyzed: da ltar ba ni sh'akya seng ge ste /
translated: The present [Buddha] is the Lion of the Śākyas.

original: dge slong sa ri'i don la sems can rnams la gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong sa ri'i don la sems can rnams la gsungs pa'o //
translated: He has spoken to sentient beings for the sake of the monk Śrī.

original: de bzhin de dang de 'dra'i srung ba dam ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin de dang de 'dra'i srung ba dam ba ni /
translated: Likewise, that excellent protection.

original: srung ba dam pa sba ba dang yongs su bskyab pa dang / sdig ba zad pa dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / chad pa gcod pa dang / 'di'i rig pa gang 'dzin pas srung zhing yongs su bskyang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srung ba dam pa sba ba dang yongs su bskyab pa dang / sdig ba zad pa dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / chad pa gcod pa dang / 'di'i rig pa gang 'dzin pas srung zhing yongs su bskyang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The highest protection is the protection of the secret and the protection of the complete protection, the exhaustion of evil, the connection, the punishment, and the protection and complete protection of whoever holds the knowledge of this.

original: sangs rgyas phyag 'tshal byang chub phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phyag 'tshal byang chub phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha, homage to enlightenment!

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: This is free from intrinsic reality and is without reference point.

original: 'das pa dang srid pa'i ngo bo med cing da ltar byung ba yang med pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang srid pa'i ngo bo med cing da ltar byung ba yang med pa'o //
translated: The past and the essence of existence do not exist, and the present also does not exist.

original: de'i sgrib pas sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pas sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Its obscuration is like an illusion.

original: me long gi lto ba'i grib ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: me long gi lto ba'i grib ma lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a shadow in the center of a mirror.

original: de ni gzugs sku dang po ste /
analyzed: de ni gzugs sku dang po ste /
translated: That is the first form body.

original: de nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bos stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa'i skus khyab ste /
analyzed: de nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bos stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa'i skus khyab ste /
translated: By the nature of its placement, the emanation body pervades the world systems of the great trichiliocosm.

original: de yang gzugs sku gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gzugs sku gnyis pa'o //
translated: That is also the second form body.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing dpe byad brgyad cus sku la brgyan pa /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing dpe byad brgyad cus sku la brgyan pa /
translated: He is endowed with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks that adorn his body.🔽

original: sems can gyi don byed pa ni thub pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa ni thub pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body of the Sage is endowed with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks, and it acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i sku gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the three bodies of the Buddha.

original: byang chub ni tshad med pa bzhi'i sgo nas sems can rnams la byams pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni tshad med pa bzhi'i sgo nas sems can rnams la byams pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is love for sentient beings through the four immeasurables.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshogs kyi lam ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshogs kyi lam ste /
translated: The path of accumulation is the ten perfections.

original: sa bcu la gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: sa bcu la gnas pa'o ;
translated: The ten grounds are the path of application.

original: ; de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: ; de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide on those grounds

original: byams pa dang 'jam dpal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang 'jam dpal la sogs pa'o //
translated: are Maitreya, Mañjuśrī, and so forth.

original: de rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
translated: Homage to them.

original: grol gyur phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: grol gyur phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the liberated one, homage to the liberator!

original: zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang shes bya'i sgrib pas ma gos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang shes bya'i sgrib pas ma gos pa ste /
translated: This means that the Buddha is unstained by the obscurations of habitual tendencies and the knowable.

original: de ni @110a * //
analyzed: de ni @110a * //
translated: That is

original: ye shes rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of pure pristine consciousness.

original: de'i ngo bo ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Its essence is inconceivable.

original: de lta bu la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'o //
translated: Homage to such a one.

original: zhi gyur phyag 'tshal zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: zhi gyur phyag 'tshal zhi la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who has attained peace, I pay homage to the peaceful one.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi ni lam yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi ni lam yin te /
translated: Here, “peace” is the path,

original: gyur ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gyur ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: and “attained” is the result.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi lam nas sangs rgyas pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi lam nas sangs rgyas pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Having attained buddhahood through the path of the six perfections, one benefits sentient beings through the power of one’s aspirations.

original: de bas na zhi gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhi gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is “peace attained.”

original: 'bras bu yin te 'gyur ba med pa rang bzhin dang bral bas /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin te 'gyur ba med pa rang bzhin dang bral bas /
translated: It is the result, free from change and intrinsic nature.

original: ye shes rnam par gsal ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes rnam par gsal ba ste /
translated: It is the clear manifestation of wisdom.

original: ye shes de yang dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes de yang dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: And that wisdom is the result that has the nature of being without reference points.

original: gzhi la mi gnas pa'i phyir zhi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi la mi gnas pa'i phyir zhi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it does not abide in a basis, it is “peace attained.”

original: gzhi dang gzhi la mi gnas pas phyag 'tshal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi la mi gnas pas phyag 'tshal zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it does not abide in a basis or in the one who abides in the basis, it is “I pay homage.”

original: rnam grol phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rnam grol phyag 'tshal grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is liberated, I pay homage to the liberator.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here,

original: 'khor ba las grol bas na grol ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba las grol bas na grol ba ste /
translated: since one is liberated from saṃsāra, one is “liberated.”

original: 'khor ba ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni ma rig pa dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang bcu gnyis so //
translated: Samsara is the twelve links of dependent origination: ignorance, volitional action, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since volitional action and so forth are stopped,

original: rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: there is liberation.

original: de grol na ma rig pa'i ming yang ci smos te /
analyzed: de grol na ma rig pa'i ming yang ci smos te /
translated: If one is liberated, what need is there even to mention the name of ignorance?

original: de bas na rnam par grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par grol la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to liberation.

original: bram ze gang dag sdig pa'i chos rnams bsal bar gyur pa de dag la yang phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bram ze gang dag sdig pa'i chos rnams bsal bar gyur pa de dag la yang phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: I also pay homage to those Brahmins who have eliminated sinful qualities.

original: tshangs par spyod cing dgra bcom pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod cing dgra bcom pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: They are of the nature of celibates and arhats.

original: de yang zag pa zad cing bag chags kyi dri mas mi bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zag pa zad cing bag chags kyi dri mas mi bsgo ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they have exhausted the defilements and are not sullied by the stains of habitual tendencies.

original: de nas bram ze'i sdig pas mi bsgo ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i sdig pas mi bsgo ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to those who are not sullied by the sins of Brahmins.

original: yang na bram ze'i tshul du gnas pas bram ze'o //
analyzed: yang na bram ze'i tshul du gnas pas bram ze'o //
translated: Or, because they abide in the manner of Brahmins, they are Brahmins.

original: de dag gis bdag la srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gis bdag la srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: The line May they protect me!

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i gzi brjid dang bden pa'i tshig gis gang zag sems can thams cad dang kun bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo'i gzi brjid dang bden pa'i tshig gis gang zag sems can thams cad dang kun bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: means that, by the power of the queen of knowledge mantras and the power of true words, all sentient beings and all people will abide in happiness.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line from all fears

original: 'jig rten phyi'i ngan song gsum gyi 'jigs pa dang / rkyen las byung ba'i nga ltar byung ba'i 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi'i ngan song gsum gyi 'jigs pa dang / rkyen las byung ba'i nga ltar byung ba'i 'jigs pa'o //
translated: means that there are fears of the three lower realms in the world beyond and fears that arise from conditions in this world.

original: tshe phyi ma'i ngan song 'byung ba ni dang po dmyal ba yin te /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i ngan song 'byung ba ni dang po dmyal ba yin te /
translated: As for the lower realms in the next life, the first is the hells.

original: tsha ba'i dmyal ba la brgyad do //
analyzed: tsha ba'i dmyal ba la brgyad do //
translated: There are eight hot hells.

original: de yang yang @110b sos dang / thig nag dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / mnar med pa dang brgyad do //
analyzed: de yang yang @110b sos dang / thig nag dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / bsdus 'joms dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / mnar med pa dang brgyad do //
translated: They are the Reviving Hell, the Black-Lined Hell, the Crushing Hell, the Hot Hell, the Intensely Hot Hell, the Hell of No Interval, the Hell of Lamentation, and the Great Hell of Lamentation.

original: yang grang ba la chu bur can dang / chu bur can chen po dang / so thams cad dang / aa chu chu dang / 'dar chug chug dang / autpa la ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa dang / padma chen po ltar gyes pa dang brgyad do //
analyzed: yang grang ba la chu bur can dang / chu bur can chen po dang / so thams cad dang / aa chu chu dang / 'dar chug chug dang / autpa la ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa dang / padma chen po ltar gyes pa dang brgyad do //
translated: Furthermore, there are eight cold hells: the Hell of Blisters, the Hell of Big Blisters, the Hell of Chattering Teeth, the Hell of the Lamentation Ah, the Hell of Splitting Like a Blue Lotus, the Hell of Splitting Like a Lotus, and the Hell of Splitting Like a Big Lotus.

original: dmyal ba de rnams kyi 'khor ni re re la yang bcu drug bcu drug go //
analyzed: dmyal ba de rnams kyi 'khor ni re re la yang bcu drug bcu drug go //
translated: Each of these hells has sixteen neighboring hells.

original: de'i ming ni mtshon gyi sen mo dang / shal ma ri dang / lcags kyi thu lum dang / khyi'i gling dang / chu bo rab med dang ; 'khrul pa'i thong pa dang / 'khor lo dang / sbu gri'i lam dang / brag dkar po dang /🔽me ma mur dang / rgya 'jigs dang / lcags kyi sog le dang / lcags kyi thur ma dang / bum pa dang / lce la rmo ba dang / sla ngas brngo ba dang bcu drug go //
analyzed: de'i ming ni mtshon gyi sen mo dang / shal ma ri dang / lcags kyi thu lum dang / khyi'i gling dang / chu bo rab med dang ; 'khrul pa'i thong pa dang / 'khor lo dang / sbu gri'i lam dang / brag dkar po dang /🔽me ma mur dang / rgya 'jigs dang / lcags kyi sog le dang / lcags kyi thur ma dang / bum pa dang / lce la rmo ba dang / sla ngas brngo ba dang bcu drug go //
translated: They are called: Knife-edge Path, Razor-edge Path, Iron-pebble River, River of No Ford, Confusing Plain, Wheel, Razor Path, White Rock, Burning Embers, Fearful Expanse, Iron Saw, Iron Needle, Pot, Tongue-ploughing, and Boiling Cauldron.

original: de ni tshe phyi ma'i dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshe phyi ma'i dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pa'o //
translated: This is the fear and suffering of the hells in the next life.

original: yang gnyis pa dud 'gro'i 'jigs pa ni gang gis gang za ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: yang gnyis pa dud 'gro'i 'jigs pa ni gang gis gang za ba'i 'jigs pa ste /
translated: The second fear is that of the animals, who are in constant fear of being eaten by others.

original: srog dang 'bral ba'i rang bzhin gyis dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal ni shin tu 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang 'bral ba'i rang bzhin gyis dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal ni shin tu 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The suffering of the animals is extremely frightening, because they are by nature killers.

original: gsum pa yi dags kyi 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa yi dags kyi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: The third fear is that of the hungry ghosts,

original: 'thung ba dang za ba med cing gang gis yang mthong ba la yang phrag dog gis 'thab rtsod byed cing /
analyzed: 'thung ba dang za ba med cing gang gis yang mthong ba la yang phrag dog gis 'thab rtsod byed cing /
translated: who are without drink or food. They are jealous of whatever they see, and they fight over it.

original: yi dags kyi sdug bsngal de rnams so //
analyzed: yi dags kyi sdug bsngal de rnams so //
translated: These are the sufferings of the hungry ghosts.

original: da ltar rkyan gyis 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar rkyan gyis 'jigs pa ni /
translated: The fear of present conditions is🔽the fear of evil spirits and demons, of encountering enemies, and so on.

original: 'byung po'i gdon ma rungs pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gzhan dgra bo dang phrad pa dang / de la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa brgyad dang de la 'jigs pas na 'jigs pa dang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gdon ma rungs pa'i 'jigs pa dang / gzhan dgra bo dang phrad pa dang / de la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa brgyad dang de la 'jigs pas na 'jigs pa dang zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of these fears, it says in the root text, fearful.

original: gnod pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnod pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnod pa ste /
translated: Harm to all roots of virtue means harm to the roots of virtue.

original: bdud bzhi'i rang bzhin gyis bgegs kyi tshul du byas nas mi dang mi ma yin pas gnod pa skyel ba'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i rang bzhin gyis bgegs kyi tshul du byas nas mi dang mi ma yin pas gnod pa skyel ba'o //
translated: The four māras, in the form of obstacles, cause harm from humans and non-humans.

original: nad 'go ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad 'go ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for epidemics,

original: rims dang / lhog pa dang / 'bras dang / khrag rnag gzer thung dang / de rnams ni yud tsam la 'gos pa'o //
analyzed: rims dang / lhog pa dang / 'bras dang / khrag rnag gzer thung dang / de rnams ni yud tsam la 'gos pa'o //
translated: they are fevers, epilepsy, smallpox, blood, pus, and sharp pains, which spread in an instant.

original: yang na 'brum bu'i nad dang gzhan gyis mi thub cing /
analyzed: yang na 'brum bu'i nad dang gzhan gyis mi thub cing /
translated: Or, they are smallpox and other incurable diseases,

original: sdig pa'i nang du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i nang du gsungs pa'o //
translated: as stated in the scriptures.

original: 'khrug pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽gzhan gyi dpung gis 'dren pa dang / rang yul du khrag khrug 'byung ba dang / gza' @111a * //
analyzed: 'khrug pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni / gzhan gyi dpung gis 'dren pa dang / rang yul du khrag khrug 'byung ba dang / gza' @111a * //
translated: As for all disturbances,

original: 'thabs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'thabs la sogs pa'o //
translated: they are invasions by foreign armies, internal conflicts, and conflicts between planets and stars, etc.

original: rims thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rims thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for all fevers,

original: bad kan dang mkhris pa dang / rlung las gyur pa de ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: bad kan dang mkhris pa dang / rlung las gyur pa de ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: they are caused by phlegm, bile, and wind, and are a combination of those.

original: gnyis gnyis 'grogs pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis 'grogs pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: The two pairs combined are associated.

original: nad de dang ldan pas na rims so //
analyzed: nad de dang ldan pas na rims so //
translated: Because of being associated with those illnesses, they are fevers.

original: nad thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for all illnesses,

original: gzhogs phyed na ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / mig na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang / kha na ba dang / mgul pa na pa dang / snying nad dang / lkog ma'i lha gor na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang /🔽so na ba dang / snying na ba dang / rtsi ba logs na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / mkhur ba na ba dang / chu so na ba dang / skye gnas na ba dang / rab tu skye gnas na ba dang /
analyzed: gzhogs phyed na ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / mig na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang / kha na ba dang / mgul pa na pa dang / snying nad dang / lkog ma'i lha gor na ba dang / rna ba na ba dang / so na ba dang / snying na ba dang / rtsi ba logs na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / lto ba na ba dang / mkhur ba na ba dang / chu so na ba dang / skye gnas na ba dang / rab tu skye gnas na ba dang /
translated: [There are] the four hundred and four diseases:🔽diseases of the side, of the throat, of the eyes, of the ears, of the mouth, of the neck, of the heart, of the uvula, of the ears,🔽of the teeth, of the heart, of the ribs, of the back, of the belly, of the cheeks, of the bladder, of the genitals, of the anus,

original: rked pa na ba dang / brla na ba dang / byin pa na ba dang / lag pa na ba dang / rkang pa na ba dang / yan lag na ba dang / nying lag na ba la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rked pa na ba dang / brla na ba dang / byin pa na ba dang / lag pa na ba dang / rkang pa na ba dang / yan lag na ba dang / nying lag na ba la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: of the waist, of the thighs, of the calves, of the hands, of the feet, of the limbs, of the minor parts, and so forth.

original: gdon thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gdon thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: [There are] all the spirits,

original: lha'i gdon la sogs pa bgegs rigs mi gcig pa stong phrag brgyad cu phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lha'i gdon la sogs pa bgegs rigs mi gcig pa stong phrag brgyad cu phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: the eighty-four thousand different kinds of obstructing spirits, such as the spirits of the gods, and so forth.

original: dug thams cad las srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dug thams cad las srung ba gyis shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Protect from all poisons!

original: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid dang sangs rgyas kyi bden pa'i tshig gis 'gro ba dang / bsdad pa dang byed pa'i dug bcom /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid dang sangs rgyas kyi bden pa'i tshig gis 'gro ba dang / bsdad pa dang byed pa'i dug bcom /
translated: By the splendor of the knowledge mantra and the words of truth of the Buddha, the poisons of moving, staying, and acting are destroyed.

original: sems can thams cad bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: All sentient beings abide in happiness.🔽May they live for a hundred years and see a hundred autumns!

original: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig / ston brgya mthong bar shog shig / ces bya ba ni 'di 'chang ba dang / klog pa rnams ni /
analyzed: lo brgya 'tsho bar gyur cig / ston brgya mthong bar shog shig / ces bya ba ni 'di 'chang ba dang / klog pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who uphold and read this

original: tshe ring zhing bkra shis te /
analyzed: tshe ring zhing bkra shis te /
translated: have long lives and are auspicious.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are free from all suffering.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo'i bden pa'i tshig gi gnas skabs te bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo'i bden pa'i tshig gi gnas skabs te bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth chapter of the Queen of Knowledge Mantras, the Great Peacock Queen, the words of truth.

original: // / kun dga' bo sngon byung ba ri'i rgyal po gangs ri'i lho phyogs kyi ngos la /
analyzed: // / kun dga' bo sngon byung ba ri'i rgyal po gangs ri'i lho phyogs kyi ngos la /
translated: Ānanda, in the past, on the southern slope of the king of mountains, the snowy mountain,

original: rma bya'i rgyal mo gser du snang ba zhes bya ba cig gnas te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rma bya'i rgyal mo gser du snang ba zhes bya ba cig gnas te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: there lived a peacock queen named Golden Radiance.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gtsug tor can gyi bstan pa la /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gtsug tor can gyi bstan pa la /
translated: In the teachings of the Perfectly Awakened One Śikhin,

original: dge slong sa ri bzhin mche ba'i dug gis btab pa la /
analyzed: dge slong sa ri bzhin mche ba'i dug gis btab pa la /
translated: Just by remembering him, those bitten by the poison of the nāga king Sārira

original: dran pa tsam gyis sos bar gyur te /
analyzed: dran pa tsam gyis sos bar gyur te /
translated: will be cured.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang nad thams cad kyis mi tshugs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang nad thams cad kyis mi tshugs shing /
translated: In the same way, they will not be harmed by any other illness.

original: gdon thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gdon thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for all spirits.🔽They will not be harmed by any of the following:

original: bsgyur ba'i las dang / byad dang / g-yeng byed dang / ro langs @111b dang ; sems bsgyur ba dang / sbod gtong dang / bza' nyes dang / skyugs nyes dang / gnod sgrib dang / gnod bltas dang / bri nyes dang / sgom nyes dang /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i las dang / byad dang / g-yeng byed dang / ro langs @111b dang ; sems bsgyur ba dang / sbod gtong dang / bza' nyes dang / skyugs nyes dang / gnod sgrib dang / gnod bltas dang / bri nyes dang / sgom nyes dang /
translated: the action of transformation, the action of sorcery, the action of distraction, the action of zombies, the action of mind transformation, the action of murder, the action of bad food, the action of bad vomiting, the action of harmful obscuration, the action of harmful gaze, the action of bad writing, the action of bad meditation,🔽or any of the following:

original: smad pa la sogs pa'i rims thams cad kyis mi tshugs shing /
analyzed: smad pa la sogs pa'i rims thams cad kyis mi tshugs shing /
translated: all fevers, such as those of the lower part of the body, and so on.

original: dran pa tsam gyis sos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa tsam gyis sos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be cured just by remembering him.🔽In the south of the Land of Jambu, to the north of the vajra seat,

original: gangs kyi ri ni lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdo rje'i gdan gyi byang phyogs na /
analyzed: gangs kyi ri ni lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdo rje'i gdan gyi byang phyogs na /
translated: at the foot of the Gandhamādana mountain,

original: ri bo spos ldan gyi rtsa na mtsho chen po ma dros pa'i 'gram na /
analyzed: ri bo spos ldan gyi rtsa na mtsho chen po ma dros pa'i 'gram na /
translated: on the shore of the great lake Anavatapta,

original: mtsho chen po de la yang chu bo chen po 'bab ste /
analyzed: mtsho chen po de la yang chu bo chen po 'bab ste /
translated: the great lake is fed by a great river.

original: de yang gangg'a dang / pakshu dang / sindhu dang / si ta dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang gangg'a dang / pakshu dang / sindhu dang / si ta dang bzhi'o //
translated: The four great rivers are the Ganges, the Pakṣu, the Sindhu, and the Sita.

original: chu bo chen po de yang shar phyogs nas babs nas g-yas skor du bskor nas shar phyogs sa su 'bab po //
analyzed: chu bo chen po de yang shar phyogs nas babs nas g-yas skor du bskor nas shar phyogs sa su 'bab po //
translated: These great rivers flow from the east, encircle the continent clockwise, and flow into the eastern ocean.

original: de bzhin du bskor nas lho dang nub dang byang phyogs la yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bskor nas lho dang nub dang byang phyogs la yang yin no //
translated: They encircle the continent in the same way in the south, west, and north.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo gser du snang ba yang /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo gser du snang ba yang /
translated: The queen of incantations, the great Peacock Queen, appears as gold.

original: sems can gyi don la gangs kyi ri la gnas shing /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la gangs kyi ri la gnas shing /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, she dwells on the snowy mountains.

original: lha dang lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / klu dang mi ma yin la sogs pas mchod cing rma bya'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / klu dang mi ma yin la sogs pas mchod cing rma bya'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
translated: She is worshipped by gods, asuras, yakshas, nagas, rakshasas, and others, and appears in the form of a peacock.

original: bzhin ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi gser gyi mdog 'dra ba /
analyzed: bzhin ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi gser gyi mdog 'dra ba /
translated: Her face is the color of the gold of Jambudvipa.

original: de'i lus la mchu bee d'uryas byas pa /
analyzed: de'i lus la mchu bee d'uryas byas pa /
translated: Her beak is made of lapis lazuli.

original: gshog pa dang mjug ma ni rin po che sna bdun gyis byas pa /
analyzed: gshog pa dang mjug ma ni rin po che sna bdun gyis byas pa /
translated: Her wings and tail are made of the seven precious substances.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis byas pa'i khri la bsdad cing /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis byas pa'i khri la bsdad cing /
translated: She sits on a throne made of the seven precious substances.

original: dug gi me tog gis brgyan cing dug za ba'o //
analyzed: dug gi me tog gis brgyan cing dug za ba'o //
translated: Adorned with poisonous flowers, she eats poison.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo 'di ni /
translated: This queen of spells

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis rjes su yi rang zhing byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis rjes su yi rang zhing byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: is approved and blessed by the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du gnas pas rma bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du gnas pas rma bya ste /
translated: She is a peacock because she abides in the nature of illusion.

original: yang na rma bya'i phyag rgyas /
analyzed: yang na rma bya'i phyag rgyas /
translated: Or else, with the seal of the peacock,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang sems can thams cad la rig sngags kyi phyag rgyas btab pas na rma bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang sems can thams cad la rig sngags kyi phyag rgyas btab pas na rma bya'o //
translated: she is a peacock because she seals all the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, Sravakas, and sentient beings with the seal of the spell.

original: chen mo ni bsam gyis mi khyab ba'o //
analyzed: chen mo ni bsam gyis mi khyab ba'o //
translated: Great means inconceivable.

original: gser du snang ba ni gser bzhin du dkon pa ste /
analyzed: gser du snang ba ni gser bzhin du dkon pa ste /
translated: Golden-colored means as rare as gold.

original: gser gyis sems can thams cad la blta na sdug pa gser du snang ba'o //
analyzed: gser gyis sems can thams cad la blta na sdug pa gser du snang ba'o //
translated: Golden-colored means that when all sentient beings look at her, they are delighted, and she is golden-colored.

original: yang na gser rin po ches dug thams cad thub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gser rin po ches dug thams cad thub pa'o //
translated: Or else, with the precious gold she conquers all poisons.

original: de nang par rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bde legs su 'gyur bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni rig sngags 'di'i byin rlabs kyis tshe 'di la ma shi bar du nyin mo bde legs shing /
analyzed: de nang par rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis bde legs su 'gyur bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni rig sngags 'di'i byin rlabs kyis tshe 'di la ma shi bar du nyin mo bde legs shing /
translated: This means that through the blessing of this spell, you will be well and happy during the day until you die in this life.

original: @112a * // nub kar yang bde legs pa'o //
analyzed: @112a * // nub kar yang bde legs pa'o //
translated: And in the evening, you will be well and happy.

original: de bzhin du tshe phyi ma yang sangs rgyas bkra shis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshe phyi ma yang sangs rgyas bkra shis par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in the next life, you will be well and happy in the auspicious state of Buddhahood.

original: mtshan mo bde legs su gnas pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan mo bde legs su gnas pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because you will be well and happy at night,

original: rmi lam ngan pa mi rmi zhing /
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa mi rmi zhing /
translated: you will not have bad dreams.

original: gdug pa can gyi 'byung po rnams kyis kyang gnod par mi byad cing /
analyzed: gdug pa can gyi 'byung po rnams kyis kyang gnod par mi byad cing /
translated: And even the evil spirits will not harm you.

original: bde bar gnyid log cing nang par yang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar gnyid log cing nang par yang rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: You will sleep peacefully and in the morning you will remember the Queen of Spells.🔽Homage to the Buddha!

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means

original: sems can rnams la don byed pa /🔽ser po dang / dmar po dang / sngon po dang / nag po la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la don byed pa / ser po dang / dmar po dang / sngon po dang / nag po la sogs ba'o //
translated: that you will benefit sentient beings.🔽It is not established by the color of the paint,

original: tshon gyi mdog gis ma grub pa /
analyzed: tshon gyi mdog gis ma grub pa /
translated: whether it is yellow, red, blue, black, and so forth.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral zhing do bo nyid med pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral zhing do bo nyid med pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the one who is free from characteristics and devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: chos la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Homage to the Dharma.

original: rgya che zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa rig pa mthar thug pa chos la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa rig pa mthar thug pa chos la phyag 'tshal zhes pa'o //
translated: This means homage to the Dharma that is vast, inconceivable, and the ultimate knowledge.

original: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Homage to the Saṅgha.

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zang pa /🔽bye brag tu smra zhing /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zang pa / bye brag tu smra zhing /
translated: This means homage to the Saṅgha of the noble ones, the arhats, those who have exhausted defilements,🔽the ones who proclaim the Abhidharma,

original: gang zag gi chos la gnas pa de bstan bsrung zhing /
analyzed: gang zag gi chos la gnas pa de bstan bsrung zhing /
translated: and those who abide by the Dharma of the individual.

original: dge 'dun tsho dang ldan pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun tsho dang ldan pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Saṅgha that possesses the four pairs of individuals.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Homage to the Queen of Spells, the Great Peacock.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo ni rig sngags kyi tshad yin te /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo ni rig sngags kyi tshad yin te /
translated: The Queen of Spells is the measure of spells.

original: rig sngags kyi tshad ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi tshad ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The measure of spells is emptiness.

original: stong pa nying de yang kun gzhi rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nying de yang kun gzhi rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: And that emptiness is the purification of the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par dag pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par dag pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The purification of the foundation consciousness is the nature of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi rang bzhin de ni rin po che rdo rje'i rigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rang bzhin de ni rin po che rdo rje'i rigs so //
translated: The nature of wisdom is the jewel vajra family.

original: de'i mtshon pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de'i mtshon pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: Its symbol is mirror-like wisdom.

original: mtshon byed ni rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo'o //
analyzed: mtshon byed ni rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo'o //
translated: The symbol is the queen of knowledge-mantras, the Great Peacock.

original: zhal bzhi phyag brgya da sku mdog mthing ga / dbu la di bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: zhal bzhi phyag brgya da sku mdog mthing ga / dbu la di bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: She has four faces, a hundred arms, and a dark-blue body, with the crowns of the five transcendent lords on her head.

original: spyi bo'i gtsug tu rdo rjes mtshan pa /
analyzed: spyi bo'i gtsug tu rdo rjes mtshan pa /
translated: Her crown is marked with a vajra.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin zhal dang po khro ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin zhal dang po khro ba'o //
translated: The nature of the five wisdoms is the first face, which is wrathful.

original: spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa /
translated: She has three eyes.

original: g-yas zhi ba /
analyzed: g-yas zhi ba /
translated: The right face is peaceful.

original: g-yon 'dzum pa /
analyzed: g-yon 'dzum pa /
translated: The left face is smiling.

original: rgyab dregs tshul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab dregs tshul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The back face has a haughty manner.

original: g-yas dkar g-yon dmar rgyab ljang gu'o //
analyzed: g-yas dkar g-yon dmar rgyab ljang gu'o //
translated: The right face is white, the left face is red, and the back face is green.

original: rgyan thams cad dang sbrul gyis brgyan cing /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad dang sbrul gyis brgyan cing /
translated: She is adorned with all ornaments and snakes.

original: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum pa'i zhabs na klu dang gnod sbyin gdug pa can mnan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum pa'i zhabs na klu dang gnod sbyin gdug pa can mnan pa'o //
translated: Her feet are in the posture of right leg extended, left leg drawn in, trampling on poisonous nāgas and yakṣas.

original: phyag g-yas pa rnams na ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa rnams na ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang / padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: In her right hands she holds a sword, a chakram, a vajra, and a lotus.

original: phyag g-yon pa rnams na sdigs mdzub dang / @112b zhags pa dang / rma bya'i sgro dang / rin po che dang / bum pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa rnams na sdigs mdzub dang / @112b zhags pa dang / rma bya'i sgro dang / rin po che dang / bum pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: The left hands hold a threatening forefinger, a noose, a peacock feather, a jewel, and a vase.

original: phung po ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po yin /
analyzed: phung po ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po yin /
translated: The aggregate is the aggregate of consciousness.

original: khams ni nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: khams ni nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: The element is the space element.

original: skye mched ni yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched ni yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The sense base is the sense base of the mind.

original: padma sna tshogs kyi steng du nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs shing /
analyzed: padma sna tshogs kyi steng du nyi ma'i gdan la bzhugs shing /
translated: He sits on a sun seat upon a multicolored lotus.

original: bskal pa me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has the radiance of an eon-ending fire.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yi ge h'um /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yi ge h'um /
translated: The syllable hūṃ is the nature of the five awarenesses.

original: de'i 'og tu nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: Below that is a sun maṇḍala.

original: de yang rig sngags kyi snying gar bsam mo //
analyzed: de yang rig sngags kyi snying gar bsam mo //
translated: That is visualized in the heart of the knowledge[-goddess].

original: sems can gyi don gyis rin po che rdo rje'i rigs kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyis rin po che rdo rje'i rigs kyi snying po'o //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, it is the essence of the jewel vajra family.

original: klu'i srog snying de rig sngags kyis nyid po 'don pa tsam gyis 'byung po thams cad rlag par byed cing /
analyzed: klu'i srog snying de rig sngags kyis nyid po 'don pa tsam gyis 'byung po thams cad rlag par byed cing /
translated: The life-force of the nāgas is the essence of the knowledge[-goddess]. Merely by reciting the knowledge[-goddess], all spirits are destroyed.

original: dug rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: dug rnams lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention poisons?

original: klu dang 'byung po rnams 'pho bar 'dod na /
analyzed: klu dang 'byung po rnams 'pho bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to move nāgas and bhūtas,

original: 'bum phrag khri bzlas pa byas nas gu gul dang btsan dug gi du ba btang zhing yungs kar gyis gdug pa can gyi gnas la brdeg / rin po che rdo rje'i rigs kyi rig sngags su bsams la /
analyzed: 'bum phrag khri bzlas pa byas nas gu gul dang btsan dug gi du ba btang zhing yungs kar gyis gdug pa can gyi gnas la brdeg / rin po che rdo rje'i rigs kyi rig sngags su bsams la /
translated: one should recite [the mantra] a hundred thousand times, and then, having burned bdellium and aconite, one should strike the abode of the evil one with white mustard seeds, imagining that the precious vajra family of knowledge mantras

original: gdug pa can rnams brlag par bya'o //
analyzed: gdug pa can rnams brlag par bya'o //
translated: will destroy the evil ones.

original: nad pa gso par 'dod na /
analyzed: nad pa gso par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to heal the sick,

original: dug dang gu gul nag po bsres nas na sar bdug par bya ste /
analyzed: dug dang gu gul nag po bsres nas na sar bdug par bya ste /
translated: one should mix poison and black bdellium and fumigate the sick place with it.

original: byug pa'i sman ni btsan dug nag po dang / mu zi nag po dang / zi ra nag po dang / danda rog po dang / ru rta dang / ldod ros dang / shu dang nag po dang / mi'i zhun gyis sbyar la byug pa bya'o //
analyzed: byug pa'i sman ni btsan dug nag po dang / mu zi nag po dang / zi ra nag po dang / danda rog po dang / ru rta dang / ldod ros dang / shu dang nag po dang / mi'i zhun gyis sbyar la byug pa bya'o //
translated: As for ointments, one should apply an ointment made of black aconite, black bitumen, black spurge, black danda, Indian valerian, costus root, black cumin, and human fat.

original: sngags kyis brdegs 'dod na yungs kar dang rma bya'i sgros brdeg go //
analyzed: sngags kyis brdegs 'dod na yungs kar dang rma bya'i sgros brdeg go //
translated: If one wishes to strike with a mantra, one should strike with white mustard seeds and peacock feathers.

original: dug zos na chu la gdab po //
analyzed: dug zos na chu la gdab po //
translated: If poison is eaten, one should cast it into water.

original: rig sngags kya rgyal mo rma bya chen mo klu'i srog snying ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig sngags kya rgyal mo rma bya chen mo klu'i srog snying ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the life-force essence of the nāgas of the queen of knowledge mantras, the Great Peacock?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: hu hu hu hu n'a ga le le le la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: hu hu hu hu n'a ga le le le la sogs pa'o //
translated: huhu huhu nāga le le le and so forth.🔽At another time, this queen of incantations, the great Uṣṇīṣavijayā, will protect

original: des dus gzhan zhig na rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis srung ba dang zhes bya ba ni srung ba'i dam pa'o //
analyzed: des dus gzhan zhig na rig sngags kyi rgyal mo rma bya chen mo 'dis srung ba dang zhes bya ba ni srung ba'i dam pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: klu'i gnyen po 'di yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi bstan pa la yang /
analyzed: klu'i gnyen po 'di yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi bstan pa la yang /
translated: This antidote to the nāgas will also bless the teachings of the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: byin gyis rlob par 'ong zhing sems can gyi don la dug nad thams cad mi gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par 'ong zhing sems can gyi don la dug nad thams cad mi gnas par bya ste /
translated: It will ensure that no disease of poison will remain in order to benefit beings.

original: 'byung po rnams rkyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams rkyang de bzhin no //
translated: The spirits will be subdued, and so forth.

original: bde legs su 'gyur bar ma byas na /🔽'dod pa rnams la zhen cing chags te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde legs su 'gyur bar ma byas na / 'dod pa rnams la zhen cing chags te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you do not ensure that all is well,🔽you will be attached to and desirous of sense objects.🔽You will be attached to and desirous of sense objects.🔽You will be attached to and desirous of sense objects.

analyzed: rma bya'i rgyal mo gser du snang ba zhes bya ba de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The Queen of Peacocks, Shining Golden” refers to

analyzed: gzhan yin pa snyam du khyod sems na /

analyzed: de ltar mi lta'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Do not see it like that” means

analyzed: sngon yang gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma stong phrag brgyad khri brgyad cu rnams de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /

analyzed: de ltar yang ngas gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: rig sngags kyi rang bzhin bsam gyis mi khyab pa brjod du med pa'o //

analyzed: ji srid sgro btags thams cad ni //

analyzed: des ni dgag dang sgrub ba med //

analyzed: shes pa gang zhig lhun grub pa / de la bsam gyis mi khyab brjod // bsam bzhin du ni mi khyab pa //

analyzed: de la bsam gyis mi khyab brjod //
translated: is said to be inconceivable.

original: gang zhig 'gro ba ma skyes zhes //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gro ba ma skyes zhes //

original: blo ni rtag pa rtog pa nyid ;
analyzed: blo ni rtag pa rtog pa nyid ;

analyzed: ;'gro ba'i gnyug ma bde ba nyid //

analyzed: blo dang ldan bas 'bad pa med //

analyzed: sgro btags kun las nges grol ba //

analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: da  nyid de'i che de'i dus na rma bya'i rgyal mo gser du snang ba zhes bya bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid rig pa'i rgyal mor snang ste /

analyzed: de ni kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gyis sems can gyi don la snang bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: @116b kun dga' bo zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don la bka' stsal pa'o //

original: stong pa nyid kyis ma grub pas /

analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa'i shes rab ni thar pa'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid lta bu'i mtshon byed ni rin chen las kyi rigs kyi rma bya chen mo'o //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nye bar bstan pa'o //

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams gsungs pa //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams gsungs pa //

original: de skad du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa'o //
